009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.util.ArrayDeque;
014import java.util.Collection;
015import java.util.Deque;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
020import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
021import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
022import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.EigensolverNxN;
023import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.RealEigensolver;
024
025public class LineFitIncremental implements LineFit {
026        
027        public static boolean VERBOSE = false;
028        
029        private double[] p = null;      // line parameters A,B,C
030        
031        private Deque<Pnt2d> points;
032        private double Sx = 0, Sy = 0, Sxx = 0, Syy = 0, Sxy = 0;
033        
034        public LineFitIncremental() {
035                this(null);
036        }
037        
038        public LineFitIncremental(Collection<Pnt2d> initPnts) {
039//              if (points.length < 2) {
040//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("line fit requires at least 2 points");
041//              }
042                points = new ArrayDeque<>();
043                if (initPnts != null) {
044                        points.addAll(initPnts);
045                }
046                init();
047        }
048        
049        // --------------------------------------------------------
050        
051        private void init() {
052                Sx = 0; Sy = 0; Sxx = 0; Syy = 0; Sxy = 0;
053                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
054                        addPoint(p);
055                }
056        }
057        
058        private void addPoint(Pnt2d pnt) {
059                final double x = pnt.getX();
060                final double y = pnt.getY();
061                Sx += x;
062                Sy += y;
063                Sxx += sqr(x);
064                Syy += sqr(y);
065                Sxy += x * y;
066                this.p = null;
067        }
068        
069        private void removePoint(Pnt2d pnt) {
070                final double x = pnt.getX();
071                final double y = pnt.getY();
072                Sx -= x;
073                Sy -= y;
074                Sxx -= sqr(x);
075                Syy -= sqr(y);
076                Sxy -= x * y;
077                this.p = null;
078        }
079        
080        // --------------------------------------------------------
081        
082        public Pnt2d[] getPoints() {
083                return points.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
084        }
085        
086        public void add(Pnt2d pnt) {
087                addLast(pnt);
088        }
089        
090        public void addFirst(Pnt2d pnt) {
091                points.addFirst(pnt);
092                addPoint(pnt);
093        }
094        
095        public void addLast(Pnt2d pnt) {
096                points.addLast(pnt);
097                addPoint(pnt);
098        }
099        
100        public Pnt2d removeFirst() {
101                Pnt2d pnt = points.removeFirst();
102                removePoint(pnt);
103                return pnt;
104        }
105        
106        public Pnt2d removeLast() {
107                Pnt2d pnt = points.removeLast();
108                removePoint(pnt);
109                return pnt;
110        }
111        
112        public Pnt2d getFirst() {
113                return points.getFirst();
114        }
115        
116        public Pnt2d getLast() {
117                return points.getLast();
118        }
119        
120        // --------------------------------------------------------
121        
122        public int getSize() {
123                return points.size();
124        }
125        
126        @Override
127        public double[] getLineParameters() {
128                if (this.getSize() < 2) {
129                        throw new IllegalStateException("cannot fit line, set of point set is less than 2");
130                }
131                if (p == null) {
132                        fit(points.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]));
133                }
134                return p;
135        }
136        
137        private void fit(Pnt2d[] pts) {
138                final int n = pts.length;
139                //System.out.println("** fitting " + n);
140                
141                double sxx = Sxx - sqr(Sx) / n;
142                double syy = Syy - sqr(Sy) / n;
143                double sxy = Sxy - Sx * Sy / n;
144                
145                double[][] S = {
146                                {sxx, sxy},
147                                {sxy, syy} 
148                };
149                
150                RealEigensolver es = new EigensolverNxN(S);
151                double[] e = es.getEigenvector(1);
152                
153                double A = e[0];
154                double B = e[1];
155                double C = -(A * Sx + B * Sy) / n;
156                
157                if (VERBOSE) {
158                        System.out.println("Sx = " + Sx);
159                        System.out.println("Sy = " + Sy);
160                        System.out.println("xc = " + PntUtils.centroid(pts));
161                        System.out.println("S = \n" + Matrix.toString(S));
162                        System.out.println("eVal = " + Matrix.toString(es.getEigenvalues()));
163                        System.out.println("eVec = \n" + Matrix.toString(es.getEigenvectors()));
164                        System.out.println("A = \n" + A);
165                        System.out.println("B = \n" + B);
166                        System.out.println("C = \n" + C);
167                }
168                this.p = new double[] {A, B, C};
169        }
170        
171        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
172        
173//      static double[][] X = {{ 10, 6 }, { 4, 3 }, { 18, 2 }, { 7, 1 }, { 5, 6 }};
174//      static double[][] X = {{ 10, 6 }, { 4, 3 }};
175//      static double[][] X = {{ 1, 1 }, { 3, 3 },  { 13, 13 }};
176        static double[][] X = {{1, 8}, {4, 5}, {4, 7}, {6, 4}, {9, 4}}; // book example
177        
178        public static void main(String[] args) {
179                PrintPrecision.set(4);
180                Pnt2d[] pts = PntUtils.fromDoubleArray(X);
181                
182//              LineFitIncremental fit = new LineFitIncremental(Arrays.asList(pts));
183                
184                LineFitIncremental fit = new LineFitIncremental();
185                System.out.println("Adding points -------------------------- ");
186                fit.add(pts[0]);
187                for (int i=1; i < X.length; i++) {
188                        fit.add(pts[i]);
189                        System.out.println("size = " + fit.getSize());
190                        AlgebraicLine line = fit.getLine();
191                        System.out.println("  line = " +  line);
192                        System.out.println("  mean square error = " + fit.getOrthogonalError(fit.getPoints()) / X.length);
193                }
194                
195                System.out.println("Removing points -------------------------- ");
196                for (int i=2; i < X.length; i++) {
197                        fit.removeLast();
198                        System.out.println("size = " + fit.getSize());
199                        AlgebraicLine line = fit.getLine();
200                        System.out.println("  line = " +  line);
201                        System.out.println("  mean square error = " + fit.getOrthogonalError(fit.getPoints()) / X.length);
202                }
203                        
204                
205                
206        }
207        
208//      line = {-0.4969, -0.8678, 7.2448}
209//      square error = 2.6645834350486606
210//      mean square error = 0.5329166870097322
211        
212        
213}
